news_items.content: Here's the rewritten list of news articles with a focus on clarity and concision:
The Madras High Court has ruled that it cannot deny entry into a temple based solely on caste, as per a court decision.
A minister in Tamil Nadu has opened an aid centre to help facilitate rent disputes between Tambaram Police Commissionerate and its landlords.
15 Tamil fishermen have returned home from Iran after efforts are being made to rescue others.
Three Chennai college students drowned in the Coimbatore River, leaving authorities scrambling to address the situation.
The government of Nainar has ordered a power shutdown for areas in Chennai due to an ongoing investigation.
A Thai woman was extorted by seducing and blackmailing Buddhist monks, resulting in a hefty price tag of over Rs 100 crore.
India's Crystal Meth worth Rs 7.6 crore was seized from Nigerian women in Pune, marking another successful operation.
The Karnataka Cabinet is set to decide on the actions following RCB victory celebrations in their meeting.
The Supreme Court has stayed an order by the Karnataka High Court regarding Kumaraswamy's victory celebrations.
Meta has introduced a feature called "Imagine Me" that allows users to generate personalized images using AI technology.
SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son believes artificial intelligence (AI) will be here within 10 years and is already working on various AI projects.
Alibaba-backed Chinese startup files for an IPO in Hong Kong, marking the first time a Chinese AI firm is going public.
Trump has touted billions of dollars in investments to create an AI hub in India.
Beijing is investing heavily in AI research to become a superpower, according to Chinese officials.
Artificial intelligence (AI) features have been added to rival US chatbots and other technology companies' products.
France's new Mistral AI system has introduced several advanced features to improve its capabilities.
